name: Great Wall
description: More than 2200 years ago, the first emperor of China, after uniting the country, ordered the construction of this wall. Although what remains today is mainly from the Ming dynasty that existed from 14th to 17th century, we can see that the first emperor wanted to defend China from the intrusion of various nomadic powers. There must have been lots of hurdles to overcome to construct the great wall. Lots of people may have been injured or even died during the construction. But we see the purpose of this monumental structure. This was to protect lives and wealth of people.

name: Segovia Aqueduct
description: The Aqueduct of Segovia is known to have been built at the end of the 1st century by Roman engineers. Roman engineers defined three dimensions of quality: Utilitas, Firmitas, and Venustas. Utilitas is the utility of the structure, Firmitas means structural integrity, and Venustas is aesthetics. Thanks to these quality criteria, the Aqueduct had been in use to transport water until 19th century.

name: Panama Canal
description: Panama Canal links the Pacific and the Atlantic Oceans. It was French people who first worked on this construction. After a successful completion of the Suez Canal, the French tried to complete this project but in vain. Technical difficulties, hostile climate, and political issues had led to the failure. It was Americans who took over the construction in early 20th century. They tried to solve those problems identified by the French people. They used the lock-approach to have different water elevations in the canal. They controlled mosquitos to deal with the disease of yellow fever. They even supported a revolution that led to the formation of Republic of Panama.

name: Incheon Bridge
description: Incheon Bridge is a part of the 21.38 km long highway linking Incheon and Seoul in Korea. As you can see, this is a cable-stayed bridge. The main span between the two pylons is 800 m, and the height of each pylon is 230.5 m. The total cost was about $2.2 billion. This structure was completed in 2009 using the so-called public-private-partnership approach. Not just tax payers’ money but also private entities money were used for this construction.

name: Burj Khalifa
description: Burj Khalifa is the tallest building of the world located in Dubai. The height is 829.8 m and there is 163 floors. This was completed in 2010. It cost about $1.5 billion. Suppose you have this money of $1.5 billion, and your job is to build this monumental structure. What would you do?

name: Eiffel Tower
description: The Eiffel Tower is a wrought-iron lattice tower located in Paris, France. It was built in 1889 as the centerpiece of the Exposition Universal, a world's fair celebrating the 100th anniversary of the French Revolution. Designed by Gustave Eiffel, the tower stands at 1,063 feet tall and was the tallest man-made structure in the world until 1930. The tower has three levels that are open to the public, with the highest level offering stunning views of the city. Today, the Eiffel Tower is one of the most recognizable landmarks in the world and is visited by millions of tourists every year.

name: Marina Bay Sands Hotel
description: Marina Bay Sands hotel in Singapore is a marvel of engineering and technology. The hotel's three towers, each standing at 55 stories tall, are built on top of a massive foundation that required over 150,000 cubic meters of concrete to construct. The SkyPark, which sits on top of the three towers, weighs more than 7,000 tonnes and is supported by four massive legs. The infinity pool on the rooftop is one of the largest in the world, holding over 1.3 million liters of water. The hotel's cooling system uses innovative technology that recycles condensate from the air-conditioning units to irrigate the hotel's gardens. Additionally, the hotel uses energy-efficient LED lighting and has implemented sustainable practices to reduce its carbon footprint.

name: Sydney Opera House
description: It is one of the representative images of Australia. The shell-like roof of the building is known to have come to mind while Uchon, a Danish architect who won the international design contest, was peeling an orange. The outer surface, which is partly circular in shape, reminds us of the small fleet of sailing ships that often sail there. The Sydney Opera House is considered one of Sydney's major tourist attractions, even if many tourists are not interested in watching the performance. The Sydney Opera House, where ballet, musical performances and operas are held, is the home of the Australian Opera Company, the Sydney Theatre Company and the Sydney Symphony Orchestra and is run by the Opera House Fund, an organization under the New South Wales State Minister of Culture. The Sydney Opera House was selected as a UNESCO World Heritage Site in 2007.

name: Empire States Building
description: The Empire State Building is a Woolworths Gothic building built in 1931 and located on 5th Street and 34th block of Manhattan Island, New York. It is 381 m high on the 102nd floor and 443 m high, including the antenna tower installed in 1953. The 16-story steel tower above the 86-story concrete building was originally built for the purpose of the airship's mooring tower, but it was rarely used because of the high wind, and now only the observatory and broadcast antenna are located. It is also famous for the scene of King Kong on the antenna tower in the movie King Kong. The Empire State Building has 73 elevators, all of which are 11 kilometers long. It also has 1,860 stairs and 6,500 windows up to the 102nd floor. There are about 940 companies and about 20,000 people working in the building. Before the World Trade Center was built, it was the tallest building in the world. It became the tallest building in New York City after the September 11 attacks destroyed the World Trade Center. With this building at its peak, the skyscraper is a symbol of the concentration of business functions in New York in the first half of the 20th century.
